active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the optimal frequency of cybersecurity training refreshers (annual vs. quarterly or event-driven). Consider factors like threat evolution, regulatory requirements (e.g., NIST), and organizational size. Provide evidence from NIST SP 800-50r1 and share personal or hypothetical examples of impacts on security culture.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity education, following university pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 25 high-quality MCQ flashcards for 'Annual Training Refreshers' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance > Personnel Security and Ethics > Security Awareness and Training Compliance > Annual Training Refreshers). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL 4 LAYERS FROM ABOVE] - Sources: NIST SP 800-50r1 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-50r1.pdf); Building A Regulation Resilient Security Awareness Program (https://ciso-perth.coriniumintelligence.com/hubfs/Whitepaper%20Building%20A%20Regulation%20Resilient%20Security%20Awareness%20Program.pdf?hsLang=en). Use Flashcard Schema exactly: Front (question + A-D options), Back (correct answer, explanation with Bloom's level/scaffolding layer/reference/active learning link, distractor rationale). Ensure progression: 8 foundational (Layers 1-2, lower Bloom's), 10 implementation (Layer 3, Apply/Analyze), 7 integration (Layer 4, Evaluate/Create). Distractors from misconceptions (e.g., no metrics needed). Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'correct_answer': '...', 'explanation': '...'}}]. Optimize for Anki import: spaced repetition, high engagement.
